intro: Tinus celebica, commonly known as the Celebes tinus, is a flowering plant native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, smooth seeds.
